title.narrative: OUTP 7.2: CHILD SENSITIVE BUDGET & FINAN

description.narrative: Output 7.2: Strengthened national capacity for child sensitive budgeting, costing and financing of services for children., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 7: Improved policy environment and equitable systems for disadvantaged and excluded children, guided by evidence and meaningful participation of children at national and decentralized levels

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child poverty public advocacy (media and social media, campaigns)

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
Development of multi-sectoral legislation/policies/strategies/action plans supporting development and participation of adolescents
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

description.narrative: Development Partner affairs policy planning and administration
Other General Services support to civil society

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 7.2: Strengthened national capacity for child sensitive budgeting, costing and financing of services for children.
Number of MTP programme reviews conducted

actual.value: 2015:MTP was replaced by a new policy framework (Zimbabwe Agenda for Sustainable Socio-Economic Transformation).

title.narrative: 1. Number of rural and urban girls and boys reached by child friendly budgeting workshops
2. Number of costing studies completed to guide delivery of minimum basic services to vulnerable women and children.

target.value: 2015:3 (Costing for free basic education, social protection and esential health benefit package completed)

actual.value: 2015:Costing of Essential health benefit package completed. Costing of social protection action plan is postponed to 2016 since the action plan is just completed. Costing of free basic education will be replaced by costing of essential nutrition package in 2016.

title.narrative: MTP M & E plan developed and implemented

target.value: 2015:MTP M & E plan developed and implemented

actual.value: 2015:UNICEF has assisted GoZ to develop an M&E Plan which is now in place.
